intro: Bertiera aequaliramosa, commonly known as the narrow-branch bertiera, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, often branching stems and small, palmate leaves. It produces clusters of yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season. Bertiera aequaliramosa is typically found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest margins.
